column4: ive just installed awesome3.1.1 in jaunty with a "make && sudo make install", is there a way to reverse the process?
not generally, although if you still have that dir "make uninstall" *might* work
(this is why "sudo make install" is not your friend, and things like fakeroot hopefully are)
is there a way to track what files are installed during a make install process?
that way i could nuke the files manually?
fakeroot
let me try to find a page describing this
any luck on that fakeroot page? im looking around... but i dont know what to look for :/
thanks for the reminder, looking again now
ok so now i know what fakeroot is, but i dont see how that should help me
I was wrong about the name, hang on
I think what I actually used was checkinstall, not fakeroot. See https://help.ubuntu.com/community/CompilingEasyHowTo
it'll figure out z automagically, but you need f (it's waiting for you to supply the file on stdin without that)
is the problem with the media key or with the command? If you bind the command to something simple like ctrl+alt+m does it work?
jrib: the command is correct (mpc next) and if i bind it to something "non-XF86......" then it works
that's very weird (you are binding by simply hitting that key, right?)
it's possible some running media player eats the key, but I don't understand why the keybinding manager still does pick it up
yupp
nope, no media player eating keys now
deluser, possibly with -m, iirc. Read the manpage first.
err, sorry, userdel
